meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a son.
meanings.sent1: His sonship was evident in the way he cared for his younger siblings.
meanings.sent2: The bond of sonship between the boy and his father was unbreakable.
meanings.sent3: In the family play, his sonship role involved rescuing his teddy bear from the 'evil' toy box.
meanings.sent4: The crown prince carried himself with the grace befitting his royal sonship.
meanings.sent5: The essence of sonship shone through in his protective nature towards his family.

meanings.definition: The relationship between a son and his parents.
meanings.sent1: Their sonship was filled with love and understanding.
meanings.sent2: The sonship blossomed as they shared stories and laughter around the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: During the game of catch, their sonship was evident in the way they communicated without words.
meanings.sent4: The strong sonship weathered the storms of life together, emerging even closer.
meanings.sent5: The sonship bond was a source of strength and comfort during tough times.

meanings.definition: The status or position of being a son.
meanings.sent1: His royal sonship meant he had certain responsibilities to uphold.
meanings.sent2: The sonship of the family heir was evident in the way he carried himself.
meanings.sent3: In the school play, his sonship role required him to wear a tiny crown.
meanings.sent4: The sonship of the eldest brought with it expectations and privileges.
meanings.sent5: The sonship of the young prince was celebrated with a grand feast in the kingdom.
